Name: Flying Falcon of King Amenemope
Description: The hawk of King Amenemope is represented stretching its wings and grasping the Shen sign to which two plaques bearing the cartouches of the king are attached. The solid gold head is turned to the left. Other parts of the hawk such as the beak, the eyes, the back of the neck, and the decorations on the cheeks are in dark glass paste. The wings, the body, and the tail of this bird of prey were executed using the cloisonnÃ© technique of applied gold threads and tiny beads. The wing feathers spread outwards and are arranged in two rows.
